name: reek
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to have a strong unpleasant smell: Her breath reeked of garlic.

Phrasal verb
reek of something
a strong unpleasant smell: The room was filled with the reek of stale beer. The warm air was scented with the heady reek of diesel oil from the bus.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
a smellsmellWhat's that terrible smell?aromaThe delicious aroma of fresh bread wafted out of the bakery.fragranceI adore the delicate fragrance of roses.perfumeThe perfume of the flowers filled the room.scentShe smelled the sweet scent of the lilies.odourUK There was the unmistakable odour of sweaty feet.

More examplesFewer examplesThe reek from the dead blue whale is strong enough to churn the stomach.Her nose was immediately assaulted by the reek of smoke.There was a smell of fish, and a bad, sour reek coming from the overcrowded houses.
